text: Brring, brring, brring, Potato Phone!

Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Lately I’ve been baking a lot of yummy homemade
scratch recipes, and I’ve been getting

a lot of requests for a retro video game, it has
been a long time since we've done something

Tetris themed, so we are gonna be making some
Tetris, Homemade Tater Tots!
Let’s get started!

To make these homemade tater tots, the things
you will need will be: 1 large pot, it’s

so big it could be like my jacuzzi! 1 Lager
saucepan, some vegetable oil, salt and pepper,

2 tablespoons of all purpose flour, 1 teaspoon
of onion powder, 1/2 a teaspoon of dill,

1/2 a teaspoon of dried oregano, and 2 teaspoons
of garlic powder.

You’ll also need 4 pounds of potatoes, I
weighed these by stepping onto my scale!

Like my bathroom scale, there’s probably
a better way to do that, but hey,
it works, it works!

I've got a strainer, cheese grater, and then we've got these
cute little puzzle crust cutters,

they look just like the Tetris bits, technically
these were made for sandwiches, so you

can cut sandwiches into these cute little
shapes, but it works perfect for
what we’re doing today!

Some tongs, and a vegetable peeler, now let’s
put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is peel
our potatoes, I’ve got 11 potatoes,

that equals 4 pounds of potatoes, but every
potato is different!

Using a vegetable peeler, it’s really easy,
just be careful, don’t get your fingers.

Once you’ve got your potato peeled, you’re
gonna do that to the rest of your potatoes,

and you’re gonna place it in the big pot,
bloop!

And once the pot is filled with potatoes you’re
gonna fill the pot with water, and you

want the water to come an inch over your potatoes,
over the potato line!

Turn the stove to medium high heat, and bring
the water to a boil.

Let the potatoes boil for 6 minutes, then
remove them from the heat, drain them
in your strainer, and let them cool.

Once your boiled potatoes have cooled, we
are gonna grate them. There’s a whole

bunch of different sized grates, I’m gonna
be using the smaller size, which is the
grate-est! A-ha-ha-ha-ha!
OK I’ll stop!

Now you’re just gonna grate all of your
potatoes.

Just finished grating all of our potatoes,
and now we’re going to dry them.

You can either use a cheese cloth or 2 clean dish
towels, I am gonna be using 2
clean dish towels.

And all you’re gonna do, is, ewp! Here’s
all of our grated potato, you’re just gonna
lay it down on top of the dish towels, boop-boop-boop-boop-boop!

Then I’m just gonna take my hands and
you’re gonna push it down flat.

Now take your second dish towel, place
it on top, and then you’re just gonna
press down to absorb all the water.

You want to get all the moisture and water
out, because when we are frying them in the
pan, the less water you have, the better.

Now we’re gonna add all of our spices, to
give it some yummy flavor!

Add a little dill, oregano, garlic powder,
yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!
Onion powder, keep it away from your eyes!
And, flour.

Then, I’m just gonna be using 2 wooden spoons, but
you can also use your hands, this is a little

bit messy, and then as you go, you can take
a little test, adding salt and pepper,
just to give it a little extra flavor.

After you’ve completely mixed in the spices,
we are gonna take our potatoes, oh!
Come here potaotes!

And we’re gonna put them on top of a cutting
board, and then we’re gonna press them
flat and cut out our shapes.

Our potatoes are all flat and now we’re
gonna cut out the shapes!

You’re gonna take your little sandwich cutter,
and you’re just gonna press it down,
doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

Then you’re gonna take out the shapes one
by one and I’m gonna transfer them over
to a little plate over here.

I wonder if this is how they make dinosaur
chicken nuggets?!?

Once we’re all done cutting these out we’re
gonna head over to the stove with our

large saucepan, and some vegetable oil. We’re
gonna fry ‘em up!

In a large saucepan, pour about 1/4 inch of
oil to cover the bottom,
then turn the heat to medium.

You’ll know when your oil is ready if you press
the end of a wooden spoon into the oil
and small bubbles will start to form.

Gently place your Tetris Tater Tots into the
pan, and cook for about 25-30 seconds,
until golden brown on the bottom.

And then take your tongs, and flip ‘em over
to cook the other side.

You can leave ‘em in a little bit longer
if you like your Tater Tots extra crispy!

After they’ve turned golden brown on each
side, pick them up with some tongs

and place them on a plate with a paper towel
to absorb the oils.

Doo-doo-doo-doo, doo-doo-doo, doo-doo-doo
doo-doo-doo, doo-doo-doo, doo-doo-doo-doo!

Doo, doo-doo, doo-doo-doo, doo-doo doo-doo-doo,
doo-doo-doo, doo-doo-doo-doo!
Tetris!

Ta-da! Here are the Homemade Tetris Tater
Tots that we made today!

This recipe is so yummy, it is my favorite
homemade tater tot recipe, and I hope you

guys enjoyed it. I’ll be posting lots of
pictures of these yummy treats on Facebook,

Twitter, Instagram and Tumblr, and if you
guys make these, please take a photo and

send it to me, I get a big kick, I love seeing
your baking creations!
Just makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Y’all ready for this?!?!? Na-na-new, da-na-na-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee!
Background: Alright....
